chunks.en: A record of a kidney stone attack experience

Two years ago, a physical examination revealed small kidney stones, so small that they didn't need treatment, just drink more water.

Looking back, I didn't seem to take it seriously. I consumed too much coffee daily, mainly lattes, supplemented with tea and drinking water.
The day before yesterday afternoon, just after coming out of the restroom, I felt a slight ache in my left lower back. I thought it was just a backache from squatting in the toilet for too long.
After a while, the pain intensified, I was covered in sweat, and I couldn't sit, stand, or lie down.
Then I called 120 and was sent to a nearby hospital. I was given a local anesthetic (painkiller), and the examination revealed that a small stone (2.5mm) had fallen and blocked the urethra.
I had an IV drip for 1 day and took medicine for 1 day, but it still flared up from time to time. I used painkillers to relieve the pain when it flared up.
It's much better on the 3rd day so far, but I'm not sure if it's been passed out. I don't know if the passage of a 2.5mm stone would be noticeable.
Currently, I'm following the doctor's advice to drink plenty of water every day and wait for it to pass naturally. If it still hurts in a few days, I'll have to get it checked again.
I advise everyone who has kidney stones to take it seriously, exercise more, drink more water. The pain is worse than giving birth.
If the stone is large, surgery is required to remove it. Men have to insert a tube into their d**k to remove the stone, which is painful to even think about.

Last year, myself: I was in so much pain in the middle of the night that I was in tears. I slowly walked out the door alone, took a taxi to the hospital, registered, waited in the emergency room queue. When it was my turn, I gritted my teeth and said, 'Give me a painkiller shot first.' I slowly walked over to pay, got the medicine, got the shot, went back to the doctor to get a test order, waited for the results, got the kidney stone diagnosis, and then took the painkillers and waited to go home.

I had it done by inserting a tube into my d**k. Inserting the catheter was quite painful, and then I had to wear a double J tube in my body for three months. When the time came, I had to pull it out of my d**k with pliers. I gasped when I pulled it out.
I remember the ureter is 4.0mm, so it's not a big problem.
Drink more water and climb stairs (not jump off a building). You've been diagnosed with kidney stones and you still dare to drink coffee every day... You're worthy of being a born workhorse.

Also, I don't dare to eat spinach casually now. Look at the information I found online: Spinach has a relatively high oxalic acid content. Long-term, large intake may increase the concentration of oxalic acid in the urine. When oxalic acid combines with calcium, it easily forms calcium oxalate stones, which is a common type of kidney stone.

chunks.en: To save 12,000 yuan in surgery costs, a man from Shandong who works as a 26-year-old programmer in Shanghai drinks 5 liters of water every day to finally pass the kidney stone. He needs to sit in front of the computer for a long time. In his spare time, he likes to go fishing. On October 20, 2024, he suddenly suffered severe lower back pain while sleeping and went to the hospital, where he was diagnosed with kidney stones in both kidneys. The kidney stone in the left kidney was stuck at the entrance of the ureter. Xiao Sun said that after learning that laser lithotripsy would cost 12,000 yuan and that he was very afraid of surgery, he finally decided to rely on drinking water and exercising to pass the kidney stone on his own. He insisted on drinking more than 5 liters of water every day and jogging 5 kilometers. After a month or two of efforts, on February 2 this year (the fifth day of the Lunar New Year), he finally passed the stone of about 9 mm. He plans to frame the stone to remind himself to drink more water at ordinary times.

The pain was so bad that I wanted to roll around on the floor of the hospital, and then after sitting outside for a while, the pain suddenly stopped. At the end of the process, the doctor said that the stone had already fallen into the urethra, and prescribed some medicine and went home.

After the examination, it was found that there was a 9mm stone in the right kidney. The doctor suggested surgery, but when I heard that the tube would be inserted from the d**k, I decisively chose lithotripsy. After the inflammation subsided on the third day, I had extracorporeal shock wave lithotripsy. The doctor told me to drink 3L of water every day.
